techs.name: Rise of Sigmar
techs.quote: Welcome to the Age of Sigmar!

techs.name: Old World
techs.quote: This is a free advance granted to Reikland, Kislev, Tilea and Estalia

civilopediaText.text: The Old World, called Elthin Arvan in the Eltharin language of the Elves, is the northwestern region of the Known World's sprawling eastern continent. It is the region of that great landmass where most of the realms of Men are located and is usually defined as the area west of the Worlds Edge Mountains, north of the Blood River and the Dwarf sea fortress of Barak Varr and south of the Troll Country. To its south lies the Badlands and the Southlands and eastward stretches the vast and mysterious Far East.

The Old World is home to the Human realms of the Empire, Kislev, Bretonnia, Tilea, Estalia, the independent city-state of Marienburg in the Wasteland, the Elven forest of Athel Loren, and the lawless Border Princes, as well as several Dwarf holds of the Karaz Ankor.

Contact with the High Elves and Dwarfs is maintained by most of the states of Men in the Old World, primarily for the pursuit of rich trading and commercial opportunities. However, the vast majority of the settled population of the Old World knows little about the wider world beyond the lands they call home.

techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Fishing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Silenna Starguided

techs.name: Hunting
techs.quote: 'Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.' - Saint Jerome

techs.name: Insatiable Hunger
uniques: [+4 Food] for every known Natural Wonder
techs.quote: 'The hungry flame sat in our guts...We ate the mountains to put it out... but the fire was still there...We climbed further still... We ate the Tall Ones' herds...Cavebeast was good meat... We climbed the peaks...Above the skies the giants dwell..'

techs.name: Archery
techs.quote: 'May the forces of evil become confused while your arrow is on its way to the target.' - George Carlin

techs.name: Chronicles
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Raw Magic
techs.quote: 'We live only to discover beauty, all else is a form of waiting' - Kahlil Gibran

techs.name: Roads
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Horseback Riding
techs.quote: 'A Horse! A Horse! My kingdom for a horse!' - Shakespeare (Richard III)

techs.name: Festivals
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Loren Magic
uniques: Gain enough Faith for [30]% of a Great Prophet

uniques: Gain enough Faith for [70]% of a Great Prophet

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: 'Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stands on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.' - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

techs.name: Metal Casting
techs.quote: 'When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Alchemy
techs.quote: 'Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.' - Calvin Coolidge

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'Do not wait to strike til the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.' - William Butler Yeats

techs.name: Underway
uniques: [Recon] units gain the [Coming from Beneath] promotion
[Melee] units gain the [Coming from Beneath] promotion
techs.quote: 'They are watching me now, I know. They are in the walls, under the stones, in the canals, everywhere.' -Doctor Anton Wiessang, Master Necromancer, last diary entry.

civilopediaText.text: The Underway, called the Ungdrin Ankor in the Dwarf tongue of Khazalid, is the name given to the vast, inter-continental highway of subterranean tunnels constructed by the Dwarfs that had at one time stretched the entirety of the World's Edge Mountains from the frozen peaks of the north to the lush jungles of the south.

Monsters of all kind lurk in even the broadest and most structurally sound sections, with a significant population of Skaven and Night Goblin tribes also taking residence. In more recent years, Dwarf expeditionary armies have managed to clear and repair a few of these tunnels to help link the scattered Holds of the Dwarfs together.

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'Better is bread with a happy heart than wealth with vexation.' - Amenemope

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: 'The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is its inefficiency' - Eugene McCarthy

uniques: Military Units gifted from City-States start with [5] XP
Militaristic City-States grant units [3] times as fast when you are at war with a common nation
May buy [Melee] units with [Gold] [in all cities]

techs.name: Chivalry
techs.quote: 'Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England.' - Malory

techs.name: Words of Salvation
uniques: When declaring friendship, both parties gain a [+20]% boost to great person generation

techs.name: Guilds
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Gold]
techs.quote: 'The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Grail Quest
techs.quote: 'That which8is sacrosanct I shall preserve. That which is sublime I will protect. That which threatens I will destroy. For my holy wrath will know no bounds...'  —The Grail Vow.

techs.name: Chaos Incursion
uniques: May buy [Shrine of the End Times] buildings with [Faith] [in all cities]
May buy [The End Times] buildings with [Faith] [in capital]

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'Instrumental or mechanical science is the noblest and, above all others, the most useful.' - Leonardo da Vinci

techs.name: Compass
techs.quote: 'I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving.' - Oliver Wendell Holmes

techs.name: Education
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to [Science]
techs.quote: 'Education is the best provision for old age.' - Aristotle

techs.name: Quintessence Force
techs.quote: 'All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.' - Sun Tzu

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: 'The press is the best instrument for enlightening the mind of man, and improving him as a rational, moral and social being.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.' - Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Steel
techs.quote: 'John Henry said to his Captain, / 'A man ain't nothin' but a man, / And before I'll let your steam drill beat me down, / I'll die with the hammer in my hand.'' - Anonymous: The Ballad of John Henry, the Steel-Drivin' Man

techs.name: Astronomy
uniques: Enables [Embarked] units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'Astronomy's much more fun when you're not an astronomer.' - Brian Miller

techs.name: Acoustics
techs.quote: 'Their rising all at once was as the sound of thunder heard remote' - Milton

techs.name: Magic Negation
techs.quote: 'No, my friends, we have not fallen back upon the earth' - Julius Verne

techs.name: Loans and Saving
techs.quote: 'Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook and a good digestion' - Jean Jacques Rousseau

techs.name: Gunpowder
techs.quote: 'The day when two army corps can annihilate each other in one second, all civilized nations, it is to be hoped, will recoil from war and discharge their troops.' - Alfred Nobel

techs.name: Architecture
techs.quote: 'Architecture begins where engineering ends.' - Walter Gropius

techs.name: Mass Media
techs.quote: 'It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.' - The Chicago Times

techs.name: Enlightenment
techs.quote: 'It ascends from the earth to the heaven, and it again descends to the earth and receives the force of things superior and inferior.' - Hermes Trismegistus

techs.name: Economics
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: 'There never was a good knife made of bad steel.' - Benjamin Franklin

techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: 'The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.' - Edward Gibbon

techs.name: Scientific Theory
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Military Science
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton

techs.name: Fertilizer
techs.quote: 'The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.' - Franklin Delano Roosevelt

techs.name: Archaeology
techs.quote: 'Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.' - George Santayana

techs.name: Mana Channeling
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Magic Industrialization
techs.quote: 'Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.' - Emily Greene Balch

techs.name: Dynamite
techs.quote: 'As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.' - Christopher Dawson

techs.name: Rifling
techs.quote: 'It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it.' - Robert E. Lee

techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: 'If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.' - Lyall Watson

techs.name: Empowerment
techs.quote: 'Technology is the foundation of the empowerment economy.' - Elise Stefanik

techs.name: Mana Battery
techs.quote: I think of the sun of as my battery, my charger.' - Alexis Ren

techs.name: Refining
techs.quote: 'Engineering is the art of directing the great sources of power in nature for the use and convenience of man.' - Thomas Tredgold

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: 'The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: 'In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.' - Cicero

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Computers
techs.quote: 'Computers are like Old Testament gods: lots of rules and no mercy.' - Joseph Campbell

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.' - Ludwig von Mises

techs.name: Ecology
techs.quote: 'Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.' - Rachel Carson

techs.name: Rocketry
techs.quote: 'A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.' - Astronautics Magazine, 1937

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: 'Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.' - Jonathan Swift

techs.name: Lasers
techs.quote: 'The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.' - The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12

techs.name: Bionic Physiology
techs.quote: '1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm. 2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law. 3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.' - Isaac Asimov

techs.name: Advanced Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power, we have guided missiles and misguided men.' – Martin Luther King Jr.

techs.name: Foresighting
techs.quote: 'It is obvious that while science is struggling to bring Heaven to Earth some men are using its materials in the construction of Hell.' - Herbert Hoover

techs.name: Future tech
uniques: Who knows what the future holds?
techs.quote: ¡¡For how many hour you have been playing??
